title: RBLDT-Based Mathematics Concept Acquisition Process for Creative Thinking and Digital Literacy

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic mathematical concepts and proficiency in fundamental smartphone usage
context.additional_context: Learners primarily access content via smartphones in PC-unavailable environments, progressing through asynchronous content and assignments without real-time video classes

learning_goals: Learners can apply three or more creative thinking techniques when solving mathematical problems using the RBLDT model.
Learners can explain mathematical concepts with over 80% accuracy using digital tools (graphing calculator apps, data visualization tools, etc.).
Learners achieve level 3 or higher on a 4-point evaluation scale in collecting and reorganizing self-directed learning materials using online communities and open educational resources.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
